lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Clam.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Clam.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* The main class for the Clam chatbot program, which consists of the {@link TaskList} task list,,
* {@link Storage} save file I/O and {@link Ui} user interface.
* This class initialises all components upon construction, and its {@code main()} method
* starts the program, with the filepath defined to be "./save.txt".
* Constructs a {@link Clam} object with the specified filepath.
* If no file is found at the specified filepath, it will create a new
* file at the specified filepath to work with.
* @param filepath the filepath for the .txt file that this {@code Clam}
*                 object will run the program with.
ui.chatbotPrint("It seems there's an error with loading the save file :(");
* Runs the program by activating the main program loop:

*
  • check if program is to be exited, if yes, exit the loop

*
  • read the next line of user input

*
  • parse the input into a command and execute it

*
  • update the exit value based on the result of the command execution
* if any errors occur during the loop, they are caught and printed by
* the {@link Ui} object, and the program continues to run (with a fresh loop).
* Represents an executable command in the Clam chatbot program.
* Each possible command in the program will be defined in a class that
* extends this abstract class, implementing the {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)}
* Constructs a {@link Command} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the relevant command with the given {@link TaskList}, {@link Ui}
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws Exception if any errors occur during the execution of the command
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws Exception;
* Returns if the command exits the program.
* @return true if the command exits the program, false otherwise
* (false by default, will be overridden if true).
* Represents the command to add a {@link Deadline} task to the task list.
* Constructs a {@link DeadlineCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the deadline command: adds a {@link Deadline} to the task list,
* displays a success/failure message and updates the save file accordingly.
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws DeadlineException if there is an invalid input
* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DeadlineException, IOException {
Deadline td = new Deadline(input.substring(9, input.indexOf("/by") - 1), input.substring(input.indexOf("/by") + 4));
ui.chatbotPrint("Got it. I've added this task:\n      " + td);
ui.chatbotPrint("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new DeadlineException("To create a new deadline item, the command is: deadline /by [due date (yyyy-mm-dd)]");
* Represents the command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a {@link DeleteCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the delete command: deletes a task from the task list,
* displays a success/failure message and updates the save file accordingly.
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws DeleteException if there is an invalid input
* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DeleteException, IOException {
ui.chatbotPrint("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new DeleteException("I'm not sure which item you're trying to delete. Try again?");
* Represents the command to add a {@link Event} task to the task list.
* Constructs a {@link EventCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the event command: adds a {@link Event} to the task list,
* displays a success/failure message and updates the save file accordingly.
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws EventException if there is an invalid input
* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws EventException, IOException {
ui.chatbotPrint("Got it. I've added this task:\n      " + td);
ui.chatbotPrint("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new EventException("To create a new event item, the command is: event /from [start (yyyy-mm-dd)] /to [end (yyyy-mm-dd)]");
* Represents the command to exit the program.
* Constructs a {@link ExitCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the exit command: displays the {@link Ui}'s bye message, before
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns true if the command exits the program.
* Since ExitCommand is, by definition, a command that exits the program,
* @return {@code true}, as this command exits the program.

* Represents the command to display the list of tasks.
* Constructs a {@link ListCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the list command: displays the list of tasks.
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.chatbotPrint("Here are the tasks in your list:" + tasklist.toString());
* Represents the command to mark a task in the task list as done.
* Constructs a {@link MarkCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the mark command: marks the indicated task in the task list as done,
* displays a success/failure message and updates the save file accordingly.
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws MarkException if there is an invalid input
* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MarkException, IOException {
ui.chatbotPrint("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n    "
throw new MarkException("I'm not sure which item you're trying to mark. Try again?");
* Represents the command to add a {@link ToDo} task to the task list.
* Constructs a {@link TodoCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the todo command: adds a {@link ToDo} to the task list,
* displays a success/failure message and updates the save file accordingly.
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws TodoException if there is an invalid input
* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TodoException, IOException {
ui.chatbotPrint("Got it. I've added this task:\n      " + td);
ui.chatbotPrint("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new TodoException("To create a new to-do item, the command is: todo [name of to-do]");
* Represents an unknown command (i.e. an invalid input).
* Will result in an error response.
* Constructs a {@link UnknownCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the unknown command: displays an error message via the provided
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("I'm not sure what command you're trying to run. Try again?");
* Represents the command to mark a task in the task list as undone.
* Constructs a {@link UnmarkCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the unmark command: marks the indicated task in the task list as undone,

* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws MarkException, IOException {

throw new MarkException("I'm not sure which item you're trying to unmark. Try again?");

* A utility class for parsing user input and returning the
* corresponding {@link Command} object or {@link DukeAction} enum value.
* Parses a string as user input and returns a {@link Command} object.
* The code returns a {@link Command} based on the first keyword in the
* input string (separated by space). The resulting {@link Command} is
* initialised with the input for its own use during its execution.
* @return the {@link Command} corresponding to the input
* Parses a string as user input and returns a {@link DukeAction} enum value.
* The code returns a {@link DukeAction} enum value based on the first keyword in the
* input string (separated by space). The resulting {@link DukeAction} enum value
* can be used to run command-specific logic.
* @return the {@link DukeAction} enum value corresponding to the input
* A utility class for loading and writing data to a save file.
* The task list data is saved in a plaintext format on a .txt file
* Constructs a {@link Storage} object with a specified filepath.
* @param filepath the filepath for the .txt file that this {@code Storage}
*                 object will read and write from
* Loads the plaintext data from the file at the specified filepath.
* Returns an empty {@link TaskList} if the file at the specified filepath
* does not exist. Otherwise, the save file will be read line by line,
* each line corresponding to one task, and added to the {@link TaskList}.
* The {@link TaskList} will be returned when all lines in the save file
* If any lines of the save file cannot be loaded properly, the line will
* be added to an error stack and thrown with an exception.
* @return a {@link TaskList} object with the corresponding tasks based
* @throws Exception if an error occurs while reading the save file
* Saves the task list data to the plaintext file at the specified filepath.
* The save file text is generated by writing one line per task in the {@link TaskList},
* with key data separated by the character "|" in a delimited fashion. The first value
* is the task type ({@code todo}/{@code deadline}/{@code event}), the second value is whether that task is marked
* or unmarked (denoted in binary fashion, {@code 0}/{@code 1}), the third value is the description (i.e
* the title of the task), and subsequent values represent extra information for {@code deadline}
* @param tasklist the task list to save to the file at the specified filepath
* @throws IOException if an error occurs with while attempting to write to the file
public void saveToFile(TaskList tasklist) throws IOException {
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* It has a description (inherited from {@link Task}) and a deadline
* Constructs a {@link Deadline} task with the given description and deadline as strings.
* The deadline is parsed into a {@link LocalDate} object.
* An enumeration to represent different possible commands that can be run
* Represents a task that occurs within a time period.
* It has a description (inherited from {@link Task}}, a start date (denoted as {@code from})
* and an end date (denoted as {@code to}), the latter two of which are stored as {@link LocalDate}
* Constructs an {@link Event} task with the given description, start date and end date as strings.
* The start and end dates are parsed into {@link LocalDate} objects.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* Marks the task as done. Nothing happens if the task is already marked as done.
* Marks the task as undone. Nothing happens if the task is already marked as undone.

* within its arraylist. It also contains other auxiliary functions such as {@code size()}.

* to store task data in the save file.

* @throws Exception if an error occurs while trying to load a task
